did.unittitle:
Community Farm of Ann Arbor records
1989-2010
did.abstract: Formed in 1988, the Community Farm of Ann Arbor is a member-owned, farmer-operated Community Supported Agriculture farm committed to biodynamic growing practices. Records consists primarily of meeting minutes, budgets, correspondence, promotional leaflets and flyers, newsletters, and newspaper clippings.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was donated in January 2010 by Community Farm of Ann Arbor (donor no. 10304).

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Community Farm of Ann Arbor records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Community Farm of Ann Arbor was established in 1988 as an experiment in Community Supported Agriculture where consumers interested in safe food and farmers seeking financial stability for their farms join in economic partnerships. All the produce is grown using biodynamic agriculture farming methods. The aim of the farm is "to grow the highest quality food possible while at the same time working to heal the earth" (Community Farm Promotional Leaflet, 1991).

During its first few years, Community Farm consisted of a five-acre garden located at 8594 West Huron River Drive. By 1992, Community Farm had moved to its current, 11-acre location at 1525 South Fletcher Road.

scopecontent.p: The Community Farm of Ann Arbor records cover the period between 1989 and 2010. The collection consists primarily of meeting minutes, budgets, correspondence, promotional leaflets and flyers, newsletters, and newspaper clippings. The collection contains two series: Administrative and Publicity.
Administrative series documents the organizational structure and annual agricultural offerings of the Community Farm of Ann Arbor. The series contains meeting minutes, budgets, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Annual meeting minutes and commitment forms, 1992-2007

scopecontent.p: Publicity series documents the history, goals, and activities of the Community Farm of Ann Arbor. The series contains promotional leaflets and flyers, newsletters, and newspaper clippings.

note.p: (photograph of woman with vegetable; and photograph of gardening plots)
